intro: Barbacenia ensifolia, commonly known as the sword-leaf barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow, sword-shaped leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are typically bright yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Barbacenia ensifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and showy blooms.
